meanings.definition: To manage or look after something
meanings.sent1: She stewarded the project to ensure it stayed on track.
meanings.sent2: The librarian stewarded the books in the library.
meanings.sent3: He stewarded the picnic basket like it was a precious treasure.
meanings.sent4: The teacher stewarded her students' progress with care.
meanings.sent5: The farmer stewarded his crops through the changing seasons.

meanings.definition: To take care of or supervise something
meanings.sent1: The park ranger stewarded the wildlife in the forest.
meanings.sent2: She stewarded the safety of the children at the playground.
meanings.sent3: He stewarded the cookies, making sure they didn't disappear before the party.
meanings.sent4: The captain stewarded the ship through the stormy seas.
meanings.sent5: The nurse stewarded the patient's recovery with dedication.
